title: Red Lentil Dahl
instructions: Heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook for 5 minutes until soft.
Add the garlic, ginger, and green chili and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in the cumin, coriander, turmeric, garam masala, and chili powder and cook for 1 minute.
Add the lentils, vegetable stock, coconut milk, and chopped tomatoes. Stir well.
Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the lentils are soft and the dahl is thick.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.
notes: You can add spinach or kale at the end for extra greens.
Adjust the chili to your preferred spice level.
Leftovers keep well in the fridge for up to 3 days or can be frozen.
